examples: His words echoed John F. Kennedy
followers echoing the cries of their leaders

results.definition: the repetition of a sound resulting from reflection of the sound waves
examples: she could hear echoes of her own footsteps

results.definition: a close parallel of a feeling, idea, style, etc.
examples: his contention contains more than an echo of Rousseau
Napoleon III was an echo of the mighty Emperor but an infinitely better man
the flower arrangement was created as an echo of a client's still life

results.definition: a reflected television or radio or radar beam
a reply that repeats what has just been said
(Greek mythology) a nymph who was spurned by Narcissus and pined away until only her voice remained
